channel.title: Player implements?

item.title: Player implements?
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

Umm, i mean like: you know when you open client.java and you see all of this:

[code]

//Project X SERVER

import java.io.;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import java.security.;
public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

//Playercount and server name at top of screen
public void writePlayers() {
int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();
sendFrame126("@red@~@gre@Project X Scape@red@~", 6570);
sendFrame126("@yel@"+playerName, 6572);
sendFrame126("@red@Players Online - " + players, 6664);
setInterfaceWalkable(6673);//6673
}[/code]

or something similar to that, and when you log on it would display it on the screen, for example the name of the server, how many people are on. ( not the clan part necessarily) but you get where i’m going with this right?

so yeah i put that under the implement, i compiled and everything but it won’t show up on the screen! hope that helps?

Read full topic

item.title: Player implements?
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

You know how in almost every server source when you log in it says the amount of players online and other things like, which clan your in or etc.

i know you have to put it under:

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

so i wrote this so it could appear to other players:

//Playercount and server name at top of screen public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); sendFrame126("@red@~@gre@Project X Scape@red@~", 6570); sendFrame126("@yel@"+playerName, 6572); sendFrame126("@red@Players Online - " + players, 6664); setInterfaceWalkable(6673);//6673 }

but when i log on, it doesn’t appear its just blank. if anyone could help me fix this? i would appreciate it.

Read full topic
